resources.string: Espresso poured on a vanilla ice cream. Served in a cappuccino cup.

Espresso with added hot water (100-150 ml). Often served in a cappuccino cup. (The espresso is added into the hot water rather than all the water being flowed through the coffee that would lead to over extraction.)
A tall, mild \'milk coffee\' (about 150-300 ml). An espresso with steamed milk and only a little milk foam poured over it. Serve in a latte glass. Flavored syrup can be added.
A concentrated coffee beverage brewed by forcing hot water under high pressure through finely-ground coffee beans.
An espresso coffee drink with a small amount of milk, usually foamed. The word “macchiato” means “stained” or “spotted” in Italian.
